ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Bhartiya gramotthan sanstha is a registered organization working since 20 years in the field of social and rural development. Employment generation is the main objective of the organization. For achieving its target the organization emphasizes on local raw material based employment. Apart from this, the other working areas of the organization is handicraft, handloom(wool, cotton, jute), jute carpet, giving commercial training to the women self help group (SHG) for income generation, helping SHG in marketing of their products, imparting technical knowledge, forestation, environment related programme, cultivating medicinal plants, implementing various health programme based on Indian medical system with the participation of the mob is the major objective of the organization. A highlight on various projects and programme being run by the organization are as follows: This project is sponsored by Ambedkar Hastashilp Vikas Yojna (A.H.V.Y), Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India. Under this project all the artisans especially bamboo craftsmen and artistic woolen weavers were given training for designing of handicrafts and provided with raw material and the organization helps them in promoting and marketing of their products for their income generation by organizing various exhibitions for exhibiting the products made by these craftsmen. 1) JUTE SERVICE CENTRE(J.S.C) This project is sponsored by National Centre for Jute Diversification (N.C.J.D), Kolkata, Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India. The organization has been working in this area for more than 10 years. Previously the artisans used to make products with local fibers only whose market was very limited. Apart from this the organization is recently running its ownJute Service Centre, which is running many projects for thediversification of jute products and generating employment for the artisans of this area 2) TRAINING OF SELF HELP GROUP To empower the rural and urban women, the organization has made women self help group which emphasizes on their awareness, small savings, various vocational trainings, providing loans, self employment generation. The organization is devoted for empowering women. TOTAL SANITATION CAMPAIGN (T.S.C) PROGRAMME Under this programme the organization along with Uttrakhand Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project (SWAJAL) assisted by Govt. of Uttrakhand and Jal Nigam, has encouraged A.P.L. and B.P.L. families of 103 gram sabha in 4 districts namely Haridwar, Uttarkashi, Dehradun and Tehri Garhwal for construction of toilets and has organized sanitation related programme. 3) EXHIBITIONS The Organisation, for the welfare of the artisans, purchases the handicraft and handloom items prepared by the local craftsmen and artisans and exhibits them in the organizations own showroom and various exhibitions organized by the Govt. so that it gives a platform where the products of the local artisans are recognized. 4) VOCATIONAL COURSES FOR SELF EMPLOYMENT The organization also sponsors various vocational courses for empowering various sects of the society. A few are listed below: â€¢ Stitching Training â€¢ Beautician course Organizing various competitions for the skill development of children and women. Promoting Micro LIC among the masses.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: We have a centre named Premdham for the abanded children whom nobody takes care. We have more than 100 inmates. Providing them shelter was one of the main concern. We have given them food and accommodation along with some vocational training. Among these children all of them are some way or otherway disabled.
WE have Seminarians under training. We provide them food and lodge. We take care of their studies.

We have centres for the differently abled children in which there are about 140 children. Some of them do attend normal classes in our integrated school where normal children help them also in their daily routines works in the school. We provide them food and lodging. Those who are not able to attend school we have arranged vocational training classes for them

We have centre for the abonded children at Premdham Ashram at Najibabad. We have got children neglected by the society. Some are mentally challenged too. There are chances of children running away from the centre. To control them we had to construct boundary wall for the centre. The amount is utilized for this purpose

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Initiated in 1981 by a group of persons deeply concerned for the preservation of environment and appropriate development of the Himalayan region in general and the Central Himalayan region of India in particular, the Central Himalayan Environment Association (CHEA) is a non-profit, independent body registered under Societies Registration Act XXI of 1860. In the course of about two decades time, CHEA has contributed to creating conditions that enable village communities to manage natural resources and benefit from them on a sustainable basis. The Association is committed to the cause of sustainable development. There are major threats to biodiversity and environment in the region from various conflicts over resource management and the manner in which development is taking place. Lack of environment- oriented regional planning and appropriate policy instruments to regulate unplanned development and provide incentives for sustainable practices are leading to imbalance in development. CHEA has resolved to concentrate and consolidate its initiatives and interventions under the following four Themes: I. Climate Change, with specific reference to Mountains and Adaptation Activities for Mountain regions; II. Rural Livelihood Initiatives in mountain regions for mitigating Rural Poverty, III. Art, Culture and Handicrafts promotion in mountains. IV. Documentation on the Mountains and the Regional Best Practices

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: VED SHIKSHAN SANSTHAN, a charitable trust formed by group of socially responsible individuals. With its genesis the trust aimed at social empowerment of the weaker sections of the region through education. The trust focused on closing the gap of access to education and skill development programs. Over the years, the trust has helped thousands under the Skill Development scheme of the Government of India. Facilitating the youth with consultation & coaching programs, for professional exams and entrance for government jobs, the trust has helped many financially weak youth by providing support & free education. We preach Social responsibility through our camps, for Clean Environment under the Swatch Bharat Abhiyan, and we act towards Social & Health awareness for women by setting up camps in rural areas for free health checkups & education. VED SHIKSHAN SANSTHAN, with its Dedication & Conviction for Social Justice, has set its goals for the future to empower the women through education & Health awareness. Giving the strength & supports to the women in rural areas, to help them rise above the social injustice and the barrier to knowledge.VED SHIKSHAN SANSTHAN will also be strengthening our existing capabilities for Empowerment through education & Access to Skill Advancement
